raw.title: [BIP-785] Enable Boosted GHO pools on Balancer v3 on Base and Arbitrum
raw.author: 0x7019Be4E4eB74cA5F61224FeAf687d2b43998516
raw.body:
### PR with Payload
https://github.com/BalancerMaxis/multisig-ops/pull/1770

# Summary

As part of the transition of GHO liquidity from Balancer v2 to v3 on Arbitrum, @TokenLogic proposes enabling the new Boosted 3pool gauge. Additionaly, with the recent launch of GHO on Base and the deployment of Balancer v3 on the same network, we want to implement a Boosted GHO/USDC pool to make this pool the home of GHO on Base.

These pools are to be considered “core pool” under BIP-19, meaning the protocol fees earned by these pool would be used to bribe for votes on it.


# Motivation

Following the success of the Boosted 3pool on Ethereum mainnet, we are now looking to replicate this approach on Layer 2 networks. Arbitrum and Base present the most suitable environments for this expansion, and we aim to introduce similar pools and gauge mechanisms to enhance liquidity efficiency and yield opportunities on these chains.

All the assets presented in the proposal will be deployed on Aave v3 instances:

Arbitrum
- [GHO](https://app.aave.com/reserve-overview/?underlyingAsset=0x7dff72693f6a4149b17e7c6314655f6a9f7c8b33&marketName=proto_arbitrum_v3)
- [USDC](https://app.aave.com/reserve-overview/?underlyingAsset=0xaf88d065e77c8cc2239327c5edb3a432268e5831&marketName=proto_arbitrum_v3)
- [USDT0](https://app.aave.com/reserve-overview/?underlyingAsset=0xfd086bc7cd5c481dcc9c85ebe478a1c0b69fcbb9&marketName=proto_arbitrum_v3)

Base 
- [GHO](https://app.aave.com/reserve-overview/?underlyingAsset=0x6bb7a212910682dcfdbd5bcbb3e28fb4e8da10ee&marketName=proto_base_v3)
- [USDC](https://app.aave.com/reserve-overview/?underlyingAsset=0x833589fcd6edb6e08f4c7c32d4f71b54bda02913&marketName=proto_base_v3)

The following Balancer v3 pools and gauges are to be created:

| Network  |   Pool Type    |   Constituents    |
| :------: | :------------  | :---------------: |
| Arbitrum |    Boosted     | aArbGHO  / aArbUSDC  / aArbUSDT  |
| Base |    Boosted     | aBasGHO  / aBasUSDC  |

For information specific to each of the constituents mentioned in the above table, please refer to the following Balancer v2 forum posts.

* [GHO/USDC/USDT Gauge Proposal](https://forum.balancer.fi/t/bip-411-enable-gho-usdt-usdc-gauge-ethereum/5135)

You can find detailed information about all these assets in the [rate provider registry]( https://github.com/balancer/code-review/blob/main/rate-providers/registry.json), which serves as a comprehensive source for all relevant details required for the review.

USDT on Arbitrum has been updated to USDT0, adopting the LayerZero OFT standard. This update ensures that USDT0 remains fully backed on a 1:1 basis with USDT on Ethereum. Users can redeem USDT0 by unlocking the corresponding USDT on Ethereum directly from Arbitrum, maintaining seamless interoperability and asset security.


# Specification

### Enable Gauges

The Balancer Maxi LM Multisig `0xc38c5f97B34E175FFd35407fc91a937300E33860` will interact with the `GaugeAdderv4` at `0x5DbAd78818D4c8958EfF2d5b95b28385A22113Cd` and call the addGauge function with the following arguments based on the table above:

#### Boosted 3pool Arbitrum 

Pool address: `0x19B001e6Bc2d89154c18e2216eec5C8c6047b6d8`
Root Gauge: `0x9b237fa1958e3022464343137738926d38815801`
Child Gauge: `0x915475b32983b7eb1235c1b6752149b454f81ad8`
GaugeType(string): `Arbitrum`

#### Boosted aBasGHO/aBasUSDC Base 

Pool address: `0x7AB124EC4029316c2A42F713828ddf2a192B36db`
Root Gauge: `0x1da19f38eb6f2c22199dc0848118b26095c29aed`
Child Gauge: `0x70db188e5953f67a4b16979a2cea26248b315401`
GaugeType(string): `Base`

## Disclosure

TokenLogic is a service provider to Aave DAO and receives no payment for creating this proposal.

Maxi Edits:
1. Assign BIP number in title and Add payload PR
2. Update Arbitrum Root and Child gauge due to typo

choices: No, this is not the way

raw.title: [BIP-383] Enable bb-rfWSTETH/bb-rfWBTC/bb-rfUSDC Gauge [Optimism]
raw.author: 0x9f74662aD05840Ba35d111930501c617920dD68e
raw.body:
### PR with Payload
https://github.com/BalancerMaxis/multisig-ops/pull/400

**Summary:**
> **bb-rfWSTETH/bb-rfWBTC/bb-rfUSDC leverages Reaper Farm multi-strategy vaults as wrapped assets. We’re using a linear pool to deposit said maintokens. Multi-strategy vaults are a next-generation technology designed by the Reaper team that automatically redirects and rebalances user funds to a selection of single strategies to maximize yield across the board. For reference, Reaper is an asset management service run by the Byte Masons who are talented developers in their own right.**

**References/Useful links:**

> Link to:
Reaper farm
[Website](https://www.reaper.farm/)
[Docs](https://docs.reaper.farm/reaper-farms/protocol-overview/master)
[Multistrategy Docs](https://docs.reaper.farm/reaper-farms/crypts/multi-strategy-vaults)

**Protocol Description:**

> **wstETH is liquid staked ETH from Lido. USDC is the dollar backed stablecoin issued by Circle. WBTC is the wrapped version of Bitcoin.**

**Motivation:**

> This proposal aims to add an uncapped veBAL gauge for the Balancer Reaper Farm Boosted Pool (bb-rfWSTETH/bb-rfWBTC/bb-rfUSDC) on Optimism and set “core pool” status under BIP-19.
This pool uses the WeightedPoolFactory-v4. Using the multi-strategy vaults, this pool can maximize yield across the Optimism network. High expected yield, combined with core pool status will help drive adoption to this pool and the recycled fees will make sure it will naturally grow under the flywheel.


**Specifications:**
 
1. **Governance:** 
Reaper Farm is part of the wider Byte Masons collective. They recently launched a [governance framework for their Oath Ecosystem](https://medium.com/@oathecosystem/unleashing-the-power-of-community-introducing-oath-governance-bcf48a7af93e).  

2. **Oracles:** 
This pool only relies on the rate providers of the linear pools to inform when yield is earned as well as on a chain link rate provider, with no write functions, for wstETH deployed [here](https://optimistic.etherscan.io/address/0x9aa3cd420f830E049e2b223D0b07D8c809C94d15#readContract).

3. **Audits:** 
[See here for reaper](https://docs.reaper.farm/reaper-farms/security/audits) and [here for lido](https://github.com/lidofinance/audits)

4. **Centralization vectors:** 
See [here ](https://lido.fi/faq) for information on this regarding Lido. There are centralization risks with USDC though the market has clearly accepted those as minor for now. Reaper Farm is managed by the Byte Masons.

5. **Market History:** 
Coingecko links are here: [USDC](https://www.coingecko.com/en/coins/usd-coin), [wstETH](https://www.coingecko.com/en/coins/wrapped-steth), [wBTC](https://www.coingecko.com/en/coins/wrapped-bitcoin)
 
6. **Value:**
We will earn the protocol fee on bb-rfWSTETH/bb-rfWBTC/bb-rfUSDC, plus trading fees. BIP-19 will incentivize TVL to continue to grow.

Link to pool: https://op.beets.fi/pool/0x8a2872fd28f42bd9f6559907235e83fbf4167f480001000000000000000000f2

Link to OP gauge: https://optimistic.etherscan.io/address/0x3390775882d3e8636c0c112a10b34d234f34d7a9

Link to root gauge: https://etherscan.io/address/0xAb6b60F389218AFf06DE279BF8c69A246568b5a6

**Transaction Specification**
The Balancer Maxi LM Multisig `eth:0xc38c5f97B34E175FFd35407fc91a937300E33860` will interact with the `GaugeAdderv4` at `0x5DbAd78818D4c8958EfF2d5b95b28385A22113Cd` and call the addGauge function with the following arguments:
gauge(address): `0xAb6b60F389218AFf06DE279BF8c69A246568b5a6`
gaugeType(string): `Optimism`

choices: No, this is not the way

raw.title: [BIP-382] Enable bb-rf-usd Gauge [Optimism]
raw.author: 0x9f74662aD05840Ba35d111930501c617920dD68e
raw.body:
### PR with Payload
https://github.com/BalancerMaxis/multisig-ops/pull/399

**Summary:**
> **bb-rf-usd is Reaper Boosted USD consisting of the three Reaper Boosted Linear pools for USDC, USDT and DAI. We’re using a linear pool to deposit said tokens into a Reaper Farm Multi-strategy Vault. Multi-strategy vaults are a next-generation technology designed by the Reaper team that automatically redirects and rebalances user funds to a selection of single strategies to maximize yield across the board. For reference, Reaper is an asset management service run by the Byte Masons who are talented developers in their own right.**

**References/Useful links:**

> Link to:
Reaper farm
-[Website](https://www.reaper.farm/)
-[Docs](https://docs.reaper.farm/reaper-farms/protocol-overview/master)
-[Multi-strategy Docs](https://docs.reaper.farm/reaper-farms/crypts/multi-strategy-vaults)


**Protocol Description:**

> USDC is the dollar backed stablecoin issued by Circle. DAI is the decentralized overcollateralized stablecoin by MakerDAO. USDT is the dollar backed stablecoin issued by Tether.

**Motivation:**

> This proposal aims to add an uncapped veBAL gauge for the Balancer Reaper Farm Boosted Pool (bb-rf-usd) on Optimism and set “core pool” status under BIP-19.
This pool uses the ComposableStablePoolFactory-v5 which fixed all the recently disclosed vulnerabilities. Using the multi-strategy vaults, this pool can maximize yield across the Optimism network. High expected yield, combined with core pool status will help drive adoption to this pool and the recycled fees will make sure it will naturally grow under the flywheel.


**Specifications:**
 
1. **Governance:** Reaper Farm is part of the wider Byte Masons collective. They recently launched a [governance framework for their Oath Ecosystem](https://medium.com/@oathecosystem/unleashing-the-power-of-community-introducing-oath-governance-bcf48a7af93e).

2. **Oracles:** This pool only relies on the rate providers of the linear pools to inform when yield is earned.

3. **Audits:** [See here](https://docs.reaper.farm/reaper-farms/security/audits)

4. **Centralization vectors:** There are centralization risks with USDC, DAI, and USDT, though the market has clearly accepted those as minor for now. Reaper Farm is managed by the Byte Masons.

5. **Market History:** Bespoke stable tokens have well-known market history.
 
6. **Value:** We will earn the protocol fee on bb-rf-usd yield, plus trading fees. BIP-19 will incentivize TVL to continue to grow. 

Link to pool: https://op.beets.fi/pool/0xcd7b2232b7435595bbc7fd7962f1f352fc2cc61a0000000000000000000000f0

Link to OP gauge: https://optimistic.etherscan.io/address/0x51ae6873e488115275bd9df3719c2a287f38cc85

Link to root gauge:
https://etherscan.io/address/0xE9816654a37aaBAEC2A742f1a1cE4c99D42c08D2

**Transaction Specification**
The Balancer Maxi LM Multisig `eth:0xc38c5f97B34E175FFd35407fc91a937300E33860` will interact with the `GaugeAdderv4` at `0x5DbAd78818D4c8958EfF2d5b95b28385A22113Cd` and call the addGauge function with the following arguments:
gauge(address): `0xE9816654a37aaBAEC2A742f1a1cE4c99D42c08D2`
gaugeType(string): `Optimism`

choices: No, this is not the way

raw.title: [BIP-763] Enable Boosted GHO 3pool on Balancer v3
raw.author: 0x7c2eA10D3e5922ba3bBBafa39Dc0677353D2AF17
raw.body:
PR with payload
https://github.com/BalancerMaxis/multisig-ops/pull/1678

## Summary

In preparations for migrating GHO liquidity from Balancer v2 to v3, @TokenLogic proposes enabling the new Boosted 3pool gauge on Ethereum.

This pool is to be considered “core pool” under BIP-19, meaning the protocol fees earned by these pool would be used to bribe for votes on it.

Within this proposal legacy gauges not being used on Balancer v2 are to be sunset.

## Motivation

With several GHO liquidity pools on Balancer v2, this publication begins the process by proposing to enable a new Boosted 3pool gauge and migrating liquidity from our largest liquidity pool across to Balancer v3.

The [Boosted 3pool](https://balancer.fi/pools/ethereum/v3/0x85B2b559bC2D21104C4DEFdd6EFcA8A20343361D) is to deploy each asset into Aave v3 to earn yield.

- GHO into Aave Prime
- USDC into Aave Core
- USDT into Aave Core

For information specific to each of the constituents mentioned above, please refer to the following Balancer v2 forum post.

* [GHO/USDC/USDT Gauge Proposal](https://forum.balancer.fi/t/bip-411-enable-gho-usdt-usdc-gauge-ethereum/5135)

You can find detailed information about all these assets in the [rate provider registry]( https://github.com/balancer/code-review/blob/main/rate-providers/registry.json), which serves as a comprehensive source for all relevant details required for the review.

We will also, use this opportunity to sunset a few under-utilised gauges across Arbitrum and Ethereum. 

The following Balancer v2 gauges are to be sunset:

| Network  |      Pool      | Gauge Address   |
| :------: | :------------:  | :---------------: |
| Ethereum | [GHO/PYUSD #1](https://balancer.fi/pools/ethereum/v2/0x4c4ed61d81f531dcb34ad4d498548917aba3d193000200000000000000000680)   | `0xb71C90F165cf99d4004499fF058E265Aa68fAC85`  |
| Ethereum | [GHO/PYUSD #2](https://balancer.fi/pools/ethereum/v2/0x8950e720eb51af9709a86941345844134517bcf40002000000000000000006e9)   | `0xAf1b4bfA0a69B9e669d925888b99741E15e37253` |
| Arbitrum | [GHO/USDC/USDT](https://balancer.fi/pools/arbitrum/v2/0xf890360473c12d8015da8dbf7af11da87337a065000000000000000000000570) | `0x7d907D8D66B6CAd285D4349F507EcdfD11FD23D2` |
| Arbitrum | [USDe/waGHO](https://balancer.fi/pools/arbitrum/v2/0x38161e9efb8de52d00a1eb0f773223fd28fdd7c20002000000000000000005a0) | `0xcfab2efef3affdd158568dc896115eac26b3c498` |

## Specification

### Enable Gauges

The Balancer Maxi LM Multisig `0xc38c5f97B34E175FFd35407fc91a937300E33860` will interact with the `GaugeAdderv4` at `0x5DbAd78818D4c8958EfF2d5b95b28385A22113Cd` and call the addGauge function with the following arguments based on the table above:

Pool address: [0x85B2b559bC2D21104C4DEFdd6EFcA8A20343361D](https://balancer.fi/pools/ethereum/v3/0x85B2b559bC2D21104C4DEFdd6EFcA8A20343361D)
Gauge(address): `0x9fdD52eFEb601E4Bc78b89C6490505B8aC637E9f`
GaugeType(string): `Ethereum`

### Kill Gauges

The DAO Multisig `0x10A19e7eE7d7F8a52822f6817de8ea18204F2e4f` will interact with the `AuthorizerAdaptorEntrypoint` at `0xf5dECDB1f3d1ee384908Fbe16D2F0348AE43a9eA` and call performAction using `0xab8f0945` for the data(bytes) argument and the “Root Gauge Address” list for each pool below will be used for the target(address) argument.

## Disclosure

TokenLogic is a service provider to Aave DAO and receives no payment for creating this proposal.

choices: No, this is not the way

raw.title: [BIP-424] Add Initial Avalanche & Base Gauges
raw.author: 0x9f74662aD05840Ba35d111930501c617920dD68e
raw.body:
PR with Payloads:
https://github.com/BalancerMaxis/multisig-ops/pull/500

#### Summary

Balancer has recently launched on the Avalanche and Base networks. Thus far both networks are teaming with new potential and it is likely through the streaming of BAL rewards higher TVL, volumes, and revenue can be tapped into. For each network the child ([AVAX](https://snowtrace.io/address/0xf23b4db826dba14c0e857029dff076b1c0264843#writeContract) , [Base](https://basescan.org/address/0xb1a4FE1C6d25a0DDAb47431A92A723dd71d9021f#writeContract)) and root gauge ([AVAX](https://etherscan.io/address/0x22625eEDd92c81a219A83e1dc48f88d54786B017#writeContract), [Base](https://etherscan.io/address/0x8e3B64b3737097F283E965869e3503AA20F31E4D#writeContract)) factories have been deployed earlier this week. The purpose of this proposal is to kickstart gauge emissions on the new chains. The gauges will all be uncapped, aside from those containing GOLD, and will be considered core pools in order to organically grow the network due to their high depth token and yield bearing natures. 

In order to add avalanche gauges to the controller, first the new gauge factory must be set for the type Avalanche.

For Base, the gaugeType must be added, and the gauge factory must be set for the new type. Furthermore, the child chain gauge factory must be added to the Base pseudo minter. 

**Motivation:**

Gauges being active on Avalanche and Base will allow Balancer to bootstrap liquidity and get the players on the networks involved in veBAL. Being through core pools, bribes, and new potential partnerships these gauges will be our foothold on each of the networks. 

#### [Setting Gauge Factories (Mainnet) Specification:](https://dashboard.tenderly.co/public/safe/safe-apps/simulator/4cb49cf2-7a27-4c25-9007-a692dca34347)

The DAO Multisig `0x10A19e7eE7d7F8a52822f6817de8ea18204F2e4f` will interact with the Authorizer `0xA331D84eC860Bf466b4CdCcFb4aC09a1B43F3aE6` calling `grantRoles` passing roles (bytes32[]) as `0x3f44776af02a9227991da37715b44e45db40735e216b3ab33144859bb6737166` , `0x2960d085c4c968d7cad55c0da3f97014525b948fdce990ecaef4e832b5f0b151` and account (address): `0x10A19e7eE7d7F8a52822f6817de8ea18204F2e4f`

The DAO Multisig `0x10A19e7eE7d7F8a52822f6817de8ea18204F2e4f` will then interact with the GaugeAdder `0x5DbAd78818D4c8958EfF2d5b95b28385A22113Cd` three times. 
1. by writing  `addGaugeType` function with the argument gaugeType (string): `Base` 

2. by writing the `setGaugeFactory` function passing factory (address) as `0x8e3B64b3737097F283E965869e3503AA20F31E4D` and gaugeType(string) and `Base`

3. by writing the `setGaugeFactory` function passing factory (address) as `0x22625eEDd92c81a219A83e1dc48f88d54786B017` and gaugeType(string) and `Avalanche`

Lastly, the DAO Multisig `0x10A19e7eE7d7F8a52822f6817de8ea18204F2e4f` will interact with the Authorizer `0xA331D84eC860Bf466b4CdCcFb4aC09a1B43F3aE6` calling `revokeRoles` passing roles (bytes32[]) as `0x3f44776af02a9227991da37715b44e45db40735e216b3ab33144859bb6737166` , `0x2960d085c4c968d7cad55c0da3f97014525b948fdce990ecaef4e832b5f0b151` and account (address): `0x10A19e7eE7d7F8a52822f6817de8ea18204F2e4f`

#### [Adding Child Chain Factory to PseduoMinter on Base](https://dashboard.tenderly.co/public/safe/safe-apps/simulator/3025344e-edf4-4e1b-93ce-ce6f2108b2fc)

The DAO Multisig on Base `0xC40DCFB13651e64C8551007aa57F9260827B6462` will interact with the Authorizer `0x809B79b53F18E9bc08A961ED4678B901aC93213a` calling `grantRole` with role (bytes32): `0xe26f8fdc1d4f5fb1b88969b7f3b9908b59db3a391dac6b94abb82fdb1e13194d` to grant the [addGaugeFactory](https://github.com/balancer/balancer-deployments/blob/master/action-ids/base/action-ids.json#L65) role for the pseduominter to itself. 

The DAO Multisig `0xC40DCFB13651e64C8551007aa57F9260827B6462` will then interact with the L2BalancerPseduoMinter `0x0c5538098EBe88175078972F514C9e101D325D4F` writing addGaugeFactory with the argument for factory (address): `0xb1a4FE1C6d25a0DDAb47431A92A723dd71d9021f`

The DAO Multisig will then call `revokeRole` on the Authorizer, revoking the addGaugeFactory role it granted to itself.

### Gauges

#### Gauges requested:

|Pool|Pool ID|Child Chain Gauge|Root Gauge|Network|
|---|---|---|---|---|
|yyAVAX/wavax|0x9fa6ab3d78984a69e712730a2227f20bcc8b5ad900000000000000000000001f|0x720158c329E6558287c4539b0Ed21742B0B73436|0x956074628A64a316086f7125074a8A52d3306321|Avalanche|
|sAVAX/WAVAX|0xfd2620c9cfcec7d152467633b3b0ca338d3d78cc00000000000000000000001c|0xf9aE6D2D56f02304f72dcC61694eAD0dC8DB51f7|0x1e916950A659Da9813EE34479BFf04C732E03deb|Avalanche|
|usdc/usdt|0xb26f0e66317846bd5fe0cbaa1d269f0efeb05c9600000000000000000000001e|0x74AbfE305bc0D729f29a2da26C5b7EF0BD1e3A8C|0xB95397A17ACbb5824535ebE69Cd9DCF8fA7aFC50|Avalanche|
|ggAVAX/WAVAX|0xc13546b97b9b1b15372368dc06529d7191081f5b00000000000000000000001d|0x231d84C37b2C4B5a2E2Fe325BB77DAa65bF71D92|0xa86e8e8CfAe8C9847fA9381d4631c13c7b3466bd|Avalanche|
|USDC/EUROC|0x55bec22f8f6c69137ceaf284d9b441db1b9bfedc000200000000000000000011|0x0c22Ff3f93B5c9f13e41FA9D270680E97AC13B28|0x40B4C2E260f803F868053789bD4A6C7Edd1cdc39|Avalanche|
|---|---|---|---|
|rETH/WETH|0xc771c1a5905420daec317b154eb13e4198ba97d0000000000000000000000023|0x8D118063B521e0CB9947A934BE90f7e32d02b158|0xd75026F8723b94d9a360A282080492d905c6A558|Base|
|cbETH/WETH|0xfb4c2e6e6e27b5b4a07a36360c89ede29bb3c9b6000000000000000000000026|0x1E8448976bD7D403e32304aEbe8b64c4A1fa7Ee8|0xefF145872582721e1b33931d61c3fE9C1ca66690|Base|
|USDC/USDbC/axlUSDC|0x0c659734f1eef9c63b7ebdf78a164cdd745586db000000000000000000000046|0x29B0C494eD7d098F4930428F115DcAf42a92392b|0xe9B2CB6836Be07357bCb8144F398730d5EC268E9|Base|
|GOLD/WETH/USDC (10%)|0x433f09ca08623e48bac7128b7105de678e37d988000100000000000000000047|0xdAe8AC766eB1c4Bb76Bc814FdE22AC46F467C51b|0xed0bb13496ce24EFFF8f9734A9707D092d4Be10c|Base|
|GOLD/BAL/USDC (2%)|0xb328b50f1f7d97ee8ea391ab5096dd7657555f49000100000000000000000048|0x7B3EF4cAD077d871499285A2A8a1Cee0Ee122137|0xbf8F01EbCf0A21C46D23ADa2C86EB31c9965B2F0|Base|


**Gauge Specification:** 

The Balancer Maxi LM Multisig eth:`0xc38c5f97B34E175FFd35407fc91a937300E33860` will interact with the GaugeAdderv4 at `0x5DbAd78818D4c8958EfF2d5b95b28385A22113Cd` and call the addGauge function with each "Root Gauge" as the `gauge(address)` argument and for each gauge the gaugeType(string): `Avalanche` or `Base` using the respective network above. 

**Disclaimer**: The first two specifications will properly simulate on Tenderly, but the gauge adds cannot be simulated successfully until the Setting Gauge Factories Specification is executed on Mainnet.

choices: No, this is not the way

decision.summary: Proposal to add Balancer V3 initial gauges on Avalanche to support protocol growth via boosted pools and incentives. Historical similar proposals with gauge activations showed positive market and TVL responses, supporting this approach. Forum discussion is neutral but technical and supportive. Timeline analytics show strong early and stable support for the 'Yes' option.
key_arguments_for: Balancer V3 on Avalanche reached rapid adoption with 10M TVL in first week, boosted by multi-month incentive program.
Activating gauges historically led to further growth in TVL, fees, and revenue on respective chains.
Similar past proposals enabling gauges on Ethereum had unanimous vote support and positive price and TVL impact.
Timeline metrics indicate early and stable strong support for 'Yes, let's do it' option.
key_arguments_against: No explicit opposition found in forum discussion or votes.
Low vote count (4 votes) may not fully represent community sentiment.

evidence.quote: Proposal aims to add gauges to newly deployed pools to enable protocol growth on Avalanche via boost and incentives.
Timeline metrics show 100% lead ratio and stability for 'Yes' option with early voting support.
Similar proposals enabling gauges had unanimous 'Yes' votes and positive price (+3.11%) and TVL (+9.14%) impacts.
Forum comments are neutral with no negative sentiment detected.

available_choices: No, this is not the way
decision.ai_final_conclusion: Option 'Yes, let's do it' selected with stance to keep 'Change'.
decision.ai_final_reason:
- Timeline analysis shows unanimous and stable early support for the 'Yes' option, indicating strong voter conviction.
- Similar historical proposals enabling gauges on Ethereum chains had unanimous approval and led to positive price and TVL growth, demonstrating efficacy of such changes.
- Forum sentiment is neutral but informative and supportive with no opposition comments, indicating community acceptance.
- Market data shows positive token price impact reinforcing protocol growth potential.
- Overall, the recommendation to 'Change' by enabling these gauges aligns with historical lessons and market/timeline analytics, despite limited vote count; forum sentiment does not contradict this recommendation.
